JobSpecification JobSpecification Class

In this Article

Edit

Specifies details of the jobs to be created on a schedule.

Syntax

Declaration

public class JobSpecificationPublic Class JobSpecification

  • Object
    Object
  • JobSpecification

Initializes a new instance of the JobSpecification class.
JobSpecification(PoolInformation, Nullable<Int32>, String, Nullable<Boolean>, Nullable<OnAllTasksComplete>, Nullable<OnTaskFailure>, JobConstraints, JobManagerTask, JobPreparationTask, JobReleaseTask, IList<EnvironmentSetting>, IList<MetadataItem>)
JobSpecification(PoolInformation, Nullable(Of Int32), String, Nullable(Of Boolean), Nullable(Of OnAllTasksComplete), Nullable(Of OnTaskFailure), JobConstraints, JobManagerTask, JobPreparationTask, JobReleaseTask, IList(Of EnvironmentSetting), IList(Of MetadataItem))

Initializes a new instance of the JobSpecification class.

Properties summary

CommonEnvironmentSettings
CommonEnvironmentSettings

Gets or sets a list of common environment variable settings. These environment variables are set for all tasks in jobs created under this schedule (including the Job Manager, Job Preparation and Job Release tasks).
Constraints
Constraints

Gets or sets the execution constraints for jobs created under this schedule.
DisplayName
DisplayName

Gets or sets the display name for jobs created under this schedule.
JobManagerTask
JobManagerTask

Gets or sets the details of a Job Manager task to be launched when a job is started under this schedule.
JobPreparationTask
JobPreparationTask

Gets or sets the Job Preparation task for jobs created under this schedule.
JobReleaseTask
JobReleaseTask

Gets or sets the Job Release task for jobs created under this schedule.
Metadata
Metadata

Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with each job created under this schedule as metadata.
OnAllTasksComplete
OnAllTasksComplete

Gets or sets the action the Batch service should take when all tasks in a job created under this schedule are in the completed state.
OnTaskFailure
OnTaskFailure

Gets or sets the action the Batch service should take when any task fails in a job created under this schedule. A task is considered to have failed if it completes with a non-zero exit code and has exhausted its retry count, or if it had a scheduling error.
PoolInfo
PoolInfo

Gets or sets the pool on which the Batch service runs the tasks of jobs created under this schedule.
Priority
Priority

Gets or sets the priority of jobs created under this schedule.
UsesTaskDependencies
UsesTaskDependencies

Gets or sets the flag that determines if this job will use tasks with dependencies.

    Initializes a new instance of the JobSpecification class.

    public JobSpecification(PoolInformation poolInfo, int ? priority = null, string displayName = null, bool ? usesTaskDependencies = null, OnAllTasksComplete? onAllTasksComplete = null, OnTaskFailure? onTaskFailure = null, JobConstraints constraints = null, JobManagerTask jobManagerTask = null, JobPreparationTask jobPreparationTask = null, JobReleaseTask jobReleaseTask = null, IList<EnvironmentSetting> commonEnvironmentSettings = null, IList<MetadataItem> metadata = null)Public Sub New(poolInfo As PoolInformation, priority As Integer? = Nothing, displayName As String = Nothing, usesTaskDependencies As Boolean? = Nothing, onAllTasksComplete As OnAllTasksComplete? = Nothing, onTaskFailure As OnTaskFailure? = Nothing, constraints As JobConstraints = Nothing, jobManagerTask As JobManagerTask = Nothing, jobPreparationTask As JobPreparationTask = Nothing, jobReleaseTask As JobReleaseTask = Nothing, commonEnvironmentSettings As IList(Of EnvironmentSetting) = Nothing, metadata As IList(Of MetadataItem) = Nothing)

    Parameters

    • poolInfo
      PoolInformation
      PoolInformation

      The pool on which the Batch service runs the tasks of jobs created under this schedule.

    • priority
      Nullable<Int32>
      Nullable(Of Int32)

      The priority of jobs created under this schedule.

    • displayName
      String
      String

      The display name for jobs created under this schedule.

    • usesTaskDependencies
      Nullable<Boolean>
      Nullable(Of Boolean)

      The flag that determines if this job will use tasks with dependencies.

    • onAllTasksComplete
      Nullable<OnAllTasksComplete>
      Nullable(Of OnAllTasksComplete)

      The action the Batch service should take when all tasks in a job created under this schedule are in the completed state.

    • onTaskFailure
      Nullable<OnTaskFailure>
      Nullable(Of OnTaskFailure)

      The action the Batch service should take when any task fails in a job created under this schedule. A task is considered to have failed if it completes with a non-zero exit code and has exhausted its retry count, or if it had a scheduling error.

    • constraints
      JobConstraints
      JobConstraints

      The execution constraints for jobs created under this schedule.

    • jobManagerTask
      JobManagerTask
      JobManagerTask

      The details of a Job Manager task to be launched when a job is started under this schedule.

    • jobPreparationTask
      JobPreparationTask
      JobPreparationTask

      The Job Preparation task for jobs created under this schedule.

    • jobReleaseTask
      JobReleaseTask
      JobReleaseTask

      The Job Release task for jobs created under this schedule.

    • commonEnvironmentSettings
      IList<EnvironmentSetting>
      IList(Of EnvironmentSetting)

      A list of common environment variable settings. These environment variables are set for all tasks in jobs created under this schedule (including the Job Manager, Job Preparation and Job Release tasks).

    • metadata
      IList<MetadataItem>
      IList(Of MetadataItem)

      A list of name-value pairs associated with each job created under this schedule as metadata.

Properties

  • Edit
    CommonEnvironmentSettings
    CommonEnvironmentSettings

    Gets or sets a list of common environment variable settings. These environment variables are set for all tasks in jobs created under this schedule (including the Job Manager, Job Preparation and Job Release tasks).

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "commonEnvironmentSettings")]
public IList<EnvironmentSetting> CommonEnvironmentSettings { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="commonEnvironmentSettings")>
Public Property CommonEnvironmentSettings As IList(Of EnvironmentSetting)

    Property Value

    • IList<EnvironmentSetting>
      IList(Of EnvironmentSetting)

    Remarks

    Individual tasks can override an environment setting specified here by specifying the same setting name with a different value.

  • Edit
    Constraints
    Constraints

    Gets or sets the execution constraints for jobs created under this schedule.

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "constraints")]
public JobConstraints Constraints { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="constraints")>
Public Property Constraints As JobConstraints

    Property Value

    • JobConstraints
      JobConstraints
  • Edit
    DisplayName
    DisplayName

    Gets or sets the display name for jobs created under this schedule.

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "displayName")]
public string DisplayName { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="displayName")>
Public Property DisplayName As String

    Property Value

    • String
      String

    Remarks

    The name need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.

  • Edit
    JobManagerTask
    JobManagerTask

    Gets or sets the details of a Job Manager task to be launched when a job is started under this schedule.

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "jobManagerTask")]
public JobManagerTask JobManagerTask { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="jobManagerTask")>
Public Property JobManagerTask As JobManagerTask

    Property Value

    • JobManagerTask
      JobManagerTask

    Remarks

    If the job does not specify a Job Manager task, the user must explicitly add tasks to the job using the Task API. If the job does specify a Job Manager task, the Batch service creates the Job Manager task when the job is created, and will try to schedule the Job Manager task before scheduling other tasks in the job.

  • Edit
    JobPreparationTask
    JobPreparationTask

    Gets or sets the Job Preparation task for jobs created under this schedule.

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "jobPreparationTask")]
public JobPreparationTask JobPreparationTask { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="jobPreparationTask")>
Public Property JobPreparationTask As JobPreparationTask

    Property Value

    • JobPreparationTask
      JobPreparationTask

    Remarks

    If a job has a Job Preparation task, the Batch service will run the Job Preparation task on a compute node before starting any tasks of that job on that compute node.

  • Edit
    JobReleaseTask
    JobReleaseTask

    Gets or sets the Job Release task for jobs created under this schedule.

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "jobReleaseTask")]
public JobReleaseTask JobReleaseTask { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="jobReleaseTask")>
Public Property JobReleaseTask As JobReleaseTask

    Property Value

    • JobReleaseTask
      JobReleaseTask

    Remarks

    The primary purpose of the Job Release task is to undo changes to compute nodes made by the Job Preparation task. Example activities include deleting local files, or shutting down services that were started as part of job preparation. A Job Release task cannot be specified without also specifying a Job Preparation task for the job. The Batch service runs the Job Release task on the compute nodes that have run the Job Preparation task.

  • Edit
    Metadata
    Metadata

    Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with each job created under this schedule as metadata.

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "metadata")]
public IList<MetadataItem> Metadata { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="metadata")>
Public Property Metadata As IList(Of MetadataItem)

    Property Value

    • IList<MetadataItem>
      IList(Of MetadataItem)

    Remarks

    The Batch service does not assign any meaning to metadata; it is solely for the use of user code.

  • Edit
    OnAllTasksComplete
    OnAllTasksComplete

    Gets or sets the action the Batch service should take when all tasks in a job created under this schedule are in the completed state.

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "onAllTasksComplete")]
public OnAllTasksComplete? OnAllTasksComplete { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="onAllTasksComplete")>
Public Property OnAllTasksComplete As OnAllTasksComplete?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<OnAllTasksComplete>
      Nullable(Of OnAllTasksComplete)

    Remarks

    Note that if a job contains no tasks, then all tasks are considered complete. This option is therefore most commonly used with a Job Manager task; if you want to use automatic job termination without a Job Manager, you should initially set onAllTasksComplete to noAction and update the job properties to set onAllTasksComplete to terminateJob once you have finished adding tasks. The default is noAction. Possible values include: 'noAction', 'terminateJob'

  • Edit
    OnTaskFailure
    OnTaskFailure

    Gets or sets the action the Batch service should take when any task fails in a job created under this schedule. A task is considered to have failed if it completes with a non-zero exit code and has exhausted its retry count, or if it had a scheduling error.

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "onTaskFailure")]
public OnTaskFailure? OnTaskFailure { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="onTaskFailure")>
Public Property OnTaskFailure As OnTaskFailure?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<OnTaskFailure>
      Nullable(Of OnTaskFailure)

    Remarks

    The default is noAction. Possible values include: 'noAction', 'performExitOptionsJobAction'

  • Edit
    PoolInfo
    PoolInfo

    Gets or sets the pool on which the Batch service runs the tasks of jobs created under this schedule.

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "poolInfo")]
public PoolInformation PoolInfo { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="poolInfo")>
Public Property PoolInfo As PoolInformation

    Property Value

    • PoolInformation
      PoolInformation
  • Edit
    Priority
    Priority

    Gets or sets the priority of jobs created under this schedule.

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "priority")]
public int ? Priority { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="priority")>
Public Property Priority As Integer?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int32>
      Nullable(Of Int32)

    Remarks

    Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority. The default value is 0. This priority is used as the default for all jobs under the job schedule. You can update a job's priority after it has been created using by using the update job API.

  • Edit
    UsesTaskDependencies
    UsesTaskDependencies

    Gets or sets the flag that determines if this job will use tasks with dependencies.

    [JsonProperty(PropertyName = "usesTaskDependencies")]
public bool ? UsesTaskDependencies { get; set; }<JsonProperty(PropertyName:="usesTaskDependencies")>
Public Property UsesTaskDependencies As Boolean?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Boolean>
      Nullable(Of Boolean)
